meanings.definition: The process of turning into wood.
meanings.sent1: During the lignification of the tree, it becomes hard like a table.
meanings.sent2: The lignification of the plant made it strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The lignification of the chair legs was so extreme, they started sprouting leaves!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the lignification of a sapling into a mighty oak.
meanings.sent5: The lignification of the fence posts made them last for decades.

meanings.sent1: In autumn, you can see the lignification of the branches as they harden.
meanings.sent2: The lignification of the roots helped the plant stand tall.
meanings.sent3: The lignification of the door handle made it feel like holding a tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness was like the lignification of a soft stem into a rigid branch.
meanings.sent5: The lignification of the old bench gave it a rustic charm.

meanings.sent1: Scientists study the lignification of plant cells to understand their structure.
meanings.sent2: The lignification of the fibers changed the texture of the material.
meanings.sent3: The lignification of the paper made it feel like touching a tree.
meanings.sent4: The lignification of the substance was a slow but fascinating process.
meanings.sent5: The lignification of the pulp resulted in a durable product.
